ticPassFail.description: Indication of whether the results of the test, inspection, or characterization passed or failed and is for informational purposes only.

Specimen.title: Specimen

specimenID.description: The identifier of the individual specimen.

specimenProcessHistory.description: Events in chronological order that occurred to a specimen after it existed in the base geometric form as specified in the applicable standard. For example, surface preparations, mounting, dye penetrant application, etc.

specimenDeviations.description: Description of any differences from recommendations made in the standards for specimen configuration and preparation.

Specimen.description: Information specific to an individual specimen. A specimen refers to the actual coupon used for a test, inspection, or characterization.  One part may contain no specimens, one specimen, or multiple specimens.  A part can also be the specimen without additional sectioning or post processing.

TICEnvironment.title: TICEnvironment

ticEnvironmentID.description: Unique identifier of test, inspection, or characterization environmental conditions.

ticEnvironmentTemperature.description: The atmospheric temperature during the test, inspection, or characterization.

ticTemperatureControlMethod.description: The method for controlling the temperature during the test, inspection, or characterization.

ticTemperatureMeasurementLocation.description: Where the temperature was measured during the test, inspection, or characterization.

ticHumidity.description: The humidity measurement during the test, inspection, or characterization.

TICEnvironment.description: The atmospheric conditions of the test, inspection, or characterization environment.

ProcessData.title: ProcessData

processMonitoringDataType.description: Type of the process monitoring data: Single Value; 1D Time Series; 2D Image; Video.

samplingRate.description: Sampling frequency of the process monitoring.

logFile.description: Data generated from the AM System, including log data.

ProcessData.description: The direct/derived output that is obtained from the AM system and in-situ monitoring system during a process. Note: the sensing data should be synchronized with the machine data and build progress (enabling temporal/spatial alignment).

Material.title: Material

materialID.description: Unique identifier for specific material instance.

materialType.description: Generic material this specific instance is an instantiation of.

materialGrade.description: Standard grade the material product conforms to.

actualChemistry.description: Chemistry characterization for the specific material instance, which may be different from the nominal chemistry.

materialStock.description: Stock information about the material from vendor/manufacturer.

measuredMaterialProperties.description: Measured intrinsic properties of the material.

specifiedMaterialProperties.description: Vendor-provided extrinsic or intrinsic material properties.

predictedMaterialProperties.description: Simulated properties for this specific material instance, which is going to be an imperfect instantiation of the ideal material and hence these properties may be slightly different from the predictedProperties found in the MaterialSpecification.

parents.description: Parent or parents of material, if it is blended or mixed.

Material.description: Specific instance of a material utilized in an AM process.

MaterialStock.title: MaterialStock

materialStockLocation.description: Physical location of a material stock.

materialStockStorageEnvironment.description: Material stock storage environment details - temperature, humidity, light.

MaterialStock.description: Information about a stock of material, including physical form, location, and purchasing information.

ParentMaterial.title: ParentMaterial

parentMaterial.description: The parent material used to create a new material.

parentMaterialPercent.description: Percent of the new material that is comprised of this parent.

ParentMaterial.description: Parent materials used to generate a new material instance (e.g., through powder blending or mixing).

baseElement.description: Base element of material from periodic table.

materialSpecification.description: Ideal chemistry specification of generic material.

MaterialSpecification.title: MaterialSpecification

specChemistry.description: The chemistry specification of the generic/ideal material.

predictedProperties.description: The predicted properties of the generic/ideal material.

MaterialSpecification.description: The ideal specification of a material, e.g., a perfect lot of Inconel 625.

MaterialProperties.title: MaterialProperties

propertyReferenceStandard.description: ASTM or other standard measurement conforms to.

propertyDataSheet.description: Reference document used to provide material properties.

MaterialProperties.description: Base class of material properties. Can be sub-classed to define specific types of material properties.

chemistryMeasurementMethod.description: Measurement method for real chemistries, which may be different from nominal chemistries. Should not be included if this is a specified chemistry.

Project.title: Project

projectID.description: Reference to the associated Project that produced this build. Links to Project record.

projectSponsor.description: Provider of money and requirements for the project.

projectDistributionStatement.description: Documentation of any restrictions of access or distribution of the data collected and analyzed under this project, by organizations other than the authoritative source.

projectPlan.description: Document describing how project is to be conducted, organized, etc.

projectStandards.description: Set of standards used in project.

projectQualityControlPlan.description: Document describing the quality control plan for the the site performing the project.

projectQualityProcessControlPlan.description: Document describing the quality process control plan for the the site performing the project.

projectDataManagementPlan.description: Data management plan of the project.

Project.description: A temporary endeavor undertaken to create one or more unique AM products or AM services. Links to all other information; may include platform, criticality, sponsors, material DB ID, organization, distribution control (e.g., ITAR restricted or not).

Part.title: Part

partName.description: Conventional name for the built part.

partDesign.description: Design information for the built part.

partCoordinateOnBuild.description: The location of the box center of the part, or an accepted reference datum.

Part.description: Instances of part designs in the as-built state.

buildPlatformMaterial.description: Material type of a build platform.

buildPlatformMaterialGrade.description: Standard grade to which the build platform material product conforms.

PartDesign.title: PartDesign

designID.description: An identifier for the part design.

designDeveloper.description: Reference to personnel who created CAD file. Links to Personnel foreign key.

designSoftware.description: Reference to CAD software name/version. Links to Software foreign key.

partCriticality.description: Criticality designation of part or parts to be developed in this project.

partRequrements.description: Document describing requirements or goals for components/specimens to be manufactured.

partDesignAugmentedSource.description: File (or pointer to file) containing source CAD for the augmented part design, complete with augmentation for support structures and other AM-specific data.

reverseEngineeredModel.description: Point cloud scanned AM part model brought back in to the CAD application for feedback and analysis.

partRevNumber.description: Revision number of the part design.

objectDefinitionFile.description: File that pertains to the part design description.

partDesignPromarySourceFile.description: File (or pointer to file) containing source CAD for the primary part design, without augmentation for support structures.

derivedFromPartDesign.description: Part Design of original part this object is derived from (if applicable).

originatingOrganization.description: Developer of the source CAD file. Links to Organization foreign key.

assmblyPartDesignList.description: list of part design and relative locations in this object - this is intended for part designs of assemblies, where the model is comprised of multiple individual part designs that are brought into the file via reference (like a build plate definition, for example).

PartDesign.description: Detailed information for the design of a part - STL, AM CAD, reverse engineered model. The part design, from which a physical object can be printed on an AM system.

BuildSimulation.title: BuildSimulation

modelDefinition.description: Documentation of how model is constructed (equations, I/O).

BuildSimulation.description: Data used and generated from computer programs using physics based models: including the models and the simulation outputs.

systemModel.description: The model name of the equipment.

systemSerialNumber.description: The serial number of the equipment defined by the vendor.

systemPurchaseDate.description: The purchase/certification date of the installed equipment.

systemLocation.description: The location where the equipment is installed.

systemCalibration.description: Calibration information. A calibration event triggers a revision to the system.

software.description: Computer programs required for operation of this system.

BuildEnvironmentalControl.title: BuildEnvironmentalControl
BuildEnvironmentalControl.description: Environment control of the build chamber on its temperature, pressure, humidity and oxygen level, for optimal quality of AM material transformation.

BuildVolume.title: BuildVolume

volumeShape.description: Shape of a building volume, i.e., 'box' or 'cylinder'.

volumeDimension.description: Width, Depth, Height of a building volume.

volumeDiameter.description: Diameter of a building volume if of cylinder type.

machineOrigin.description: Origin X,Y,Z as defined by machine manufacturer relative to build volume center.

totalBuildVolume.description: The total usable volume available in the AM System.

machineLastCleanoutDate.description: The date when the build volume was last cleaned.

BuildVolume.description: Total usable volume available in the machine for building parts.

processableRawMaterial.description: A processable raw material list of an AM machine.

maintenanceDate.description: Date of last AM system Maintenance.

softwareName.description: A unique identifier for the software.

softwareVendor.description: Software Vendor identification. Links to Organization foreign key.

softwareVersion.description: The version number of the software.

softwareConfigurationSettingsFile.description: specific software settings document, for this project/component.

organizationID.description: The unique identifier of the organization.

organizationType.description: The type or roles of an organization, whether it is a manufacturer, vendor, supplier, or contractor.  One organization may have many types.

organizationQualification.description: Details of the organization's qualifications and certifications.

organizationPhoneNumber.description: A phone number for the organization.

organizationPointOfContact.description: Identification of the point of contact.

personFirstName.description: First name of individual performing task.

personLastName.description: Last name of individual performing task.

personPhoneNumber.description: The phone number for the individual.

Qualification.title: Qualification

qualifyingOrganization.description: The organization from which the qualification or certification originates.

Qualification.description: Details of qualification/certification (machine specific operator certificate, UL, ASTM).

datasetSubject.description: Classification, keyword, or phrase that describes the topic of the dataset at the endpoint of the URI. This is a refinement of the Dublin Core definition that states this is the topic of the resource and the plurality of keywords, etc. It should be noted that the recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary (per Dublin Core).

datasetType.description: Media type, formerly known as MIME Type, a two-part identifier for file formats and format contents transmitted on the Internet. The Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA) is the official authority for the standardization and publication of these classifications.

datasetURI.description: URI location where a dataset can be found.

datesetFormat.description: Formal description language that describes the format or layout of the file, such as CSV with Headers, Protobuf, fixed position, JSON Schema, XML, Cobol Copybook, X12 and so forth.

datasetSchemaURI.description: Location via a URI pointer to the specific Content Format Specification that describes how to parse the content in a repository; i.e., defines the schema of the content in the repository.

datasetCreator.description: Creator of dataset and/or the metadata of the dataset.

datasetCreationDateTime.description: Point of time associated with creation of the dataset. May be used at any level of granularity. Recommended best practice is to use an encoding scheme, such as the W3CDTF profile of ISO 8601 [W3CDTF].

datesetType.description: Dataset type, raw data or synthesized data.

datasetQuantityType.description: Type of Measurement(s) that would appear in a dataset; e.g., pH, Moisture, Temperature, requiring an industry group to define the enumerated list/controlled vocabulary for the specific business context.

datasetKeyDataElements.description: Data elements of principal interest within a dataset, particularly useful for traceability applications.

datasetAccessControl.description: How to get access to the dataset. Control Code Type is used to communicate 'Restricted', 'Consent', and 'Public'.

OrganizationQualification.title: OrganizationQualification

qualifyingOrganization.description: The organization from which the qualification or certification originates.

OrganizationQualification.description: Details of qualification/certification for an organization.

PersonQualification.title: PersonQualification

qualifyingOrganization.description: The organization from which the qualification or certification originates.

personQualificationNumberOfHours.description: The number of hours that this person has completed on this equipment/software/system.

PersonQualification.description: Details of qualification/certification for a person.

AMInsituData.title: AMInsituData

datasetSubject.description: Classification, keyword, or phrase that describes the topic of the dataset at the endpoint of the URI. This is a refinement of the Dublin Core definition that states this is the topic of the resource and the plurality of keywords, etc. It should be noted that the recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary (per Dublin Core).

datasetType.description: Media type, formerly known as MIME Type, a two-part identifier for file formats and format contents transmitted on the Internet. The Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA) is the official authority for the standardization and publication of these classifications.

datasetURI.description: URI location where a dataset can be found.

datesetFormat.description: Formal description language that describes the format or layout of the file, such as CSV with Headers, Protobuf, fixed position, JSON Schema, XML, Cobol Copybook, X12 and so forth.

datasetSchemaURI.description: Location via a URI pointer to the specific Content Format Specification that describes how to parse the content in a repository; i.e., defines the schema of the content in the repository.

datasetCreator.description: Creator of dataset and/or the metadata of the dataset.

datasetCreationDateTime.description: Point of time associated with creation of the dataset. May be used at any level of granularity. Recommended best practice is to use an encoding scheme, such as the W3CDTF profile of ISO 8601 [W3CDTF].

datesetType.description: Dataset type, raw data or synthesized data.

datasetQuantityType.description: Type of Measurement(s) that would appear in a dataset; e.g., pH, Moisture, Temperature, requiring an industry group to define the enumerated list/controlled vocabulary for the specific business context.

datasetKeyDataElements.description: Data elements of principal interest within a dataset, particularly useful for traceability applications.

datasetAccessControl.description: How to get access to the dataset. Control Code Type is used to communicate 'Restricted', 'Consent', and 'Public'.

characteristicsType.description: characteristics measured, eg, melt pool geometry, melt pool temperature, powder bed surface, exposure surface.

measurementType.description: Technique used for the measurement, eg, co-axial optical camera.

measurementLocation.description: The location of what is being monitored, eg, build surface, coaxial melt pool area.

inSituDevice.description: Device used for the in-situ measuremen.

inSituDeviceSetting.description: in-situ device setting for the measurement, including acquisition settings, for example, camera model, sampling rate, protocol, etc.

AMInsituData.description: Data generated by in-situ monitoring systems during an AM Build cycle.

buildPlatformPreheatTemperature.description: Temperature setting the build platform is heated to prior to print.

buildPlatformLevelingMethod.description: Description of the method of platform leveling  procedures and tools.

buildPlatformZStartPosition.description: Z position of top of build plate prior to starting a build. Must be a part of the setup procedures.

buildPlatformPreheatProfile.description: Heating profile setting for reaching pre-heat temperature.

layerThickness.description: Setting for the incremental distance between built layers.

buildEnvironmentTemperature.description: Build environment/chamber temperature is important to some FDM processes; Bob will provide a definition.

PowderLot.title: PowderLot

materialID.description: Unique identifier for specific material instance.

materialType.description: Generic material this specific instance is an instantiation of.

materialGrade.description: Standard grade the material product conforms to.

actualChemistry.description: Chemistry characterization for the specific material instance, which may be different from the nominal chemistry.

materialStock.description: Stock information about the material from vendor/manufacturer.

measuredMaterialProperties.description: Measured intrinsic properties of the material.

specifiedMaterialProperties.description: Vendor-provided extrinsic or intrinsic material properties.

predictedMaterialProperties.description: Simulated properties for this specific material instance, which is going to be an imperfect instantiation of the ideal material and hence these properties may be slightly different from the predictedProperties found in the MaterialSpecification.

parents.description: Parent or parents of material, if it is blended or mixed.

virginOrUsed.description: If the powder lot is new (virgin) or been used previously.

reuseNumber.description: The number of times the powder lot has been used, 0 if virgin or 1 or more if reused.  If 0 the powder has never been used, if 1 the powder has been used once, etc.

PowderLot.description: Unique lot of powder material used in one or more builds.

IntrinsicMaterialProperties.title: IntrinsicMaterialProperties

propertyReferenceStandard.description: ASTM or other standard measurement conforms to.

propertyDataSheet.description: Reference document used to provide material properties.

IntrinsicMaterialProperties.description: Properties that are independent of the AM processing/part characteristics, such as x-ray density, lattice structure, and heat capacity.

ExtrinsicMaterialProperties.title: ExtrinsicMaterialProperties

propertyReferenceStandard.description: ASTM or other standard measurement conforms to.

propertyDataSheet.description: Reference document used to provide material properties.

ExtrinsicMaterialProperties.description: Properties that are dependent upon the AM processing/part characteristics, such as tap density, and thermal conductivity.

propertyReferenceStandard.description: ASTM or other standard measurement conforms to.

propertyDataSheet.description: Reference document used to provide material properties.

propertyReferenceStandard.description: ASTM or other standard measurement conforms to.

propertyDataSheet.description: Reference document used to provide material properties.

propertyReferenceStandard.description: ASTM or other standard measurement conforms to.

propertyDataSheet.description: Reference document used to provide material properties.

propertyReferenceStandard.description: ASTM or other standard measurement conforms to.

propertyDataSheet.description: Reference document used to provide material properties.

propertyReferenceStandard.description: ASTM or other standard measurement conforms to.

propertyDataSheet.description: Reference document used to provide material properties.

Process.title: Process
Process.description: All stages of manufacturing processes of a part.

ProcessStep.title: ProcessStep

sequenceNumber.description: Sequence identifier of processing steps in chronological order.

processStandard.description: Standards used to guide a process, e.g., AMS2774.

processControlPlan.description: Document that describes the methods taken to ensure the quality control of critical inputs to deliver outputs that meet requirements.

ProcessStep.description: Event performed as part of a sequence.  May include pre-processing, build, post-processing, and (destructive or non-destructuve) test, inspection, and/or characterization operations.

sequenceNumber.description: Sequence identifier of processing steps in chronological order.

processStandard.description: Standards used to guide a process, e.g., AMS2774.

processControlPlan.description: Document that describes the methods taken to ensure the quality control of critical inputs to deliver outputs that meet requirements.

sequenceNumber.description: Sequence identifier of processing steps in chronological order.

processStandard.description: Standards used to guide a process, e.g., AMS2774.

processControlPlan.description: Document that describes the methods taken to ensure the quality control of critical inputs to deliver outputs that meet requirements.

MachinePreparation.title: MachinePreparation

sequenceNumber.description: Sequence identifier of processing steps in chronological order.

processStandard.description: Standards used to guide a process, e.g., AMS2774.

processControlPlan.description: Document that describes the methods taken to ensure the quality control of critical inputs to deliver outputs that meet requirements.

MachinePreparation.description: Operations to prepare an AM machine before a build starts, e.g., cleaning, pre-warming.

BuildPlatformPreparation.title: BuildPlatformPreparation

sequenceNumber.description: Sequence identifier of processing steps in chronological order.

processStandard.description: Standards used to guide a process, e.g., AMS2774.

processControlPlan.description: Document that describes the methods taken to ensure the quality control of critical inputs to deliver outputs that meet requirements.

BuildPlatformPreparation.description: Description of how the build platform was prepared before the AM process (ex. new or recycled).

PostProcess.title: PostProcess

sequenceNumber.description: Sequence identifier of processing steps in chronological order.

processStandard.description: Standards used to guide a process, e.g., AMS2774.

processControlPlan.description: Document that describes the methods taken to ensure the quality control of critical inputs to deliver outputs that meet requirements.

postProcessType.description: Type of a post process, e.g., heat treatment, HIP, etc.

PostProcess.description: Note: The scope of post-processes is broad, which could include assembly as necessary for a part test/certification.

HotIsostaticPressing.title: HotIsostaticPressing

sequenceNumber.description: Sequence identifier of processing steps in chronological order.

processStandard.description: Standards used to guide a process, e.g., AMS2774.

processControlPlan.description: Document that describes the methods taken to ensure the quality control of critical inputs to deliver outputs that meet requirements.

postProcessType.description: Type of a post process, e.g., heat treatment, HIP, etc.

hotIsostaticPressingProcessParameters.description: Nominal process parameters used during hot isostatic pressing.

HotIsostaticPressing.description: Hot isostatic processing, which applies heat and pressure simultaneously to objects in an autoclave via an inert gas in such a way as to eliminate internal voids and obtain desired properties.

HotIsostaticPressingProcessParameters.title: HotIsostaticPressingProcessParameters

inertGas.description: A non-oxidizing gas used for pressurizing a HIP vessel.

vesselPressure.description: Pressure measurement of the autoclave during the HIP Process.

vesselTemperature.description: Temperature recorded of the autoclave during the HIP process.

HotIsostaticPressingProcessParameters.description: Nominal process parameters used during hot isostatic pressing (HIP).

sequenceNumber.description: Sequence identifier of processing steps in chronological order.

processStandard.description: Standards used to guide a process, e.g., AMS2774.

processControlPlan.description: Document that describes the methods taken to ensure the quality control of critical inputs to deliver outputs that meet requirements.

postProcessType.description: Type of a post process, e.g., heat treatment, HIP, etc.

heatTreatmentProcessParameters.description: Nominal process parameters used during heat treatment.

maintenanceDate.description: Date of last AM system Maintenance.

calibrationOperator.description: Person performing the machine calibration. Links to Personnel ID.

calibrationResults.description: The results of the equipment calibration (files, etc.).

NonAMSystem.title: NonAMSystem

systemModel.description: The model name of the equipment.

systemSerialNumber.description: The serial number of the equipment defined by the vendor.

systemPurchaseDate.description: The purchase/certification date of the installed equipment.

systemLocation.description: The location where the equipment is installed.

systemCalibration.description: Calibration information. A calibration event triggers a revision to the system.

software.description: Computer programs required for operation of this system.

NonAMSystem.description: Non AM system equipment/devices required for pre/post processes and post inspection.

AMSystem.title: AMSystem

systemModel.description: The model name of the equipment.

systemSerialNumber.description: The serial number of the equipment defined by the vendor.

systemPurchaseDate.description: The purchase/certification date of the installed equipment.

systemLocation.description: The location where the equipment is installed.

systemCalibration.description: Calibration information. A calibration event triggers a revision to the system.

software.description: Computer programs required for operation of this system.

machineAcceptanceDate.description: Date when an AM machine is certified as Installation Qualified (passes the site acceptance test, or Installation qualification).

systemProcessType.description: Process category of an AM system defined by ASTM 52900 process categories.

systemSubprocessType.description: Sub Process category of an AM system.

machineElectricVoltage.description: Voltage for an AM Machine's electrical connection.

machinePowerIntensity.description: Current intensity required to power an AM Machine.

machinePowerFrequency.description: Power frequency for the electrical connection of an AM Machine.

systemInstallationQualification.description: A certification capturing the basic calibration and test build(s) performed after installation of machine; aka, suite acceptance report,  tied to a machine serial number.

systemOperationQualification.description: A certification capturing process control, maintenance, calibration to ensure a stable process that meets the requirements of a material specification; tied to a machine serial number.

systemFacility.description: Name of the facility where an AM system is installed.

machineHazmatRequirements.description: A document of a link to AM Machine HAZMAT Requirements.

AMSystem.description: Additive Manufacturing System Machine and auxiliary equipment used for additive manufacturing.

InSituMonitoringSystem.title: InSituMonitoringSystem

systemModel.description: The model name of the equipment.

systemSerialNumber.description: The serial number of the equipment defined by the vendor.

systemPurchaseDate.description: The purchase/certification date of the installed equipment.

systemLocation.description: The location where the equipment is installed.

systemCalibration.description: Calibration information. A calibration event triggers a revision to the system.

software.description: Computer programs required for operation of this system.

inSituMonitoringSystemTechnology.description: The technology, including both hardware and software, used to observe and record the progress of an additive manufacturing process.

inSituMonitoringSystemSensingType.description: The type of an in-situ monitoring sensing technique.

inSituMonitoringSystemSamplingRate.description: Default sampling rate: Hz for time series data; fps for evenly sampled imaging system; images/layers for layerwise imaging system.

InSituMonitoringSystem.description: The technology, including both hardware and software, used to observe and record the progress of an additive manufacturing process as it occurs in real time.  Each individual piece of monitoring technology constitutes a separate in-situ monitoring system. An in-situ monitoring system may be built into an AM System by the AM System Manufacturer, or a third-party monitoring system may be attached by the owning organization.

systemModel.description: The model name of the equipment.

systemSerialNumber.description: The serial number of the equipment defined by the vendor.

systemPurchaseDate.description: The purchase/certification date of the installed equipment.

systemLocation.description: The location where the equipment is installed.

systemCalibration.description: Calibration information. A calibration event triggers a revision to the system.

software.description: Computer programs required for operation of this system.

SpecificSubsystem.description: Describes equipment that can be interchanged from AMSystem or InSituMonitoringSystem that would be in use for a build.

systemModel.description: The model name of the equipment.

systemSerialNumber.description: The serial number of the equipment defined by the vendor.

systemPurchaseDate.description: The purchase/certification date of the installed equipment.

systemLocation.description: The location where the equipment is installed.

systemCalibration.description: Calibration information. A calibration event triggers a revision to the system.

software.description: Computer programs required for operation of this system.

machineAcceptanceDate.description: Date when an AM machine is certified as Installation Qualified (passes the site acceptance test, or Installation qualification).

systemProcessType.description: Process category of an AM system defined by ASTM 52900 process categories.

systemSubprocessType.description: Sub Process category of an AM system.

machineElectricVoltage.description: Voltage for an AM Machine's electrical connection.

machinePowerIntensity.description: Current intensity required to power an AM Machine.

machinePowerFrequency.description: Power frequency for the electrical connection of an AM Machine.

systemInstallationQualification.description: A certification capturing the basic calibration and test build(s) performed after installation of machine; aka, suite acceptance report,  tied to a machine serial number.

systemOperationQualification.description: A certification capturing process control, maintenance, calibration to ensure a stable process that meets the requirements of a material specification; tied to a machine serial number.

systemFacility.description: Name of the facility where an AM system is installed.

machineHazmatRequirements.description: A document of a link to AM Machine HAZMAT Requirements.

TestInspectionCharacterization.title: TestInspectionCharacterization

sequenceNumber.description: Sequence identifier of processing steps in chronological order.

processStandard.description: Standards used to guide a process, e.g., AMS2774.

processControlPlan.description: Document that describes the methods taken to ensure the quality control of critical inputs to deliver outputs that meet requirements.

ticID.description: An identifier of the test, inspection or characterization type.

ticName.description: A short description of the test, inspection, or characterization.

ticType.description: Type of test/inspection/characterization, such as tensile test, fatigue test, etc.

ticStandard.description: An identifier of the corresponding standard used.

ticStartTime.description: Start time and date of the test, inspection, or characterization.

ticEndTime.description: End time and date of the test, inspection, or characterization.

ticLocation.description: The physical location where the test was conducted.

ticNotes.description: Itemized descriptions of observations relating to the individual test, inspection, or characterization of an individual specimen.

ticOperator.description: Identifier of the operator who facilitated the test, inspection, or characterization linking to Personnel ID.

ticPointOfContact.description: The name of the point of contact for the task being performed, if not the person performing the task.

ticVendor.description: Identifier of Vendor/Supplier/Contractor who physically performed the test, inspection, or characterization linking to Organization ID.

ticEquipment.description: Identifier of Non-AM Equipment used during the test, inspection, or characterization.

ticSoftware.description: Identifier of any Software that was used during the test, inspection, or characterization.

ticProcedure.description: The procedure used if it is not from an existing standard.

ticDestructureVsNonDestructive.description: Indication of whether the test, inspection, or characterization irreversibly changed the nature of the specimen.

ticDuration.description: The time that the Test took (Test only).

ticEnvironment.description: The atmospheric conditions of the test environment.

TestInspectionCharacterization.description: Any test, inspection, or characterization performed on any part or material specimen from any stage of the additive manufacturing fabrication process (excluding in-process monitoring).

NonPedigreedTestResult.title: NonPedigreedTestResult

ticPassFail.description: Indication of whether the results of the test, inspection, or characterization passed or failed and is for informational purposes only.

testedMaterial.description: Material that was tested by the vendor of the material.

NonPedigreedTestResult.description: Vendor-provided extrinsic or intrinsic material properties.

PartSpecimen.title: PartSpecimen

specimenID.description: The identifier of the individual specimen.

specimenProcessHistory.description: Events in chronological order that occurred to a specimen after it existed in the base geometric form as specified in the applicable standard. For example, surface preparations, mounting, dye penetrant application, etc.

specimenDeviations.description: Description of any differences from recommendations made in the standards for specimen configuration and preparation.

specimenCoordinate.description: The location that the specimen was extracted from the original part.

specimenTestLocation.description: Location of the test, inspection, or characterization relative to the specimen.

specimenOrientation.description: The orientation of the specimen relative to the AM part (the orientation with respect to the build platform can be traced through the part's orientation).

specimenExtractionMethod.description: The method in which the sample or specimen was extracted from the part.

PartSpecimen.description: A specimen that is extracted from a Part. Not to be confused with MaterialSpecimen

MaterialSpecimen.title: MaterialSpecimen

specimenID.description: The identifier of the individual specimen.

specimenProcessHistory.description: Events in chronological order that occurred to a specimen after it existed in the base geometric form as specified in the applicable standard. For example, surface preparations, mounting, dye penetrant application, etc.

specimenDeviations.description: Description of any differences from recommendations made in the standards for specimen configuration and preparation.

MaterialSpecimen.description: A specimen that is extracted from  a Material. Not to be confused with a PartSpecimen

organizationID.description: The unique identifier of the organization.

organizationType.description: The type or roles of an organization, whether it is a manufacturer, vendor, supplier, or contractor.  One organization may have many types.

organizationQualification.description: Details of the organization's qualifications and certifications.

organizationPhoneNumber.description: A phone number for the organization.

organizationPointOfContact.description: Identification of the point of contact.
